title: Croatia’s Euro Experience Shows Stability and Economic Benefits, Says Deputy Central Bank Governor
description: The adoption of the euro has brought both stability and increased opportunities for the economy, Michael Faulend, deputy governor of the Croatian Central Bank, told BNR. Faulend, who played a central role in Croatia’s euro adoption in 2023, said that while many Croatians still remember the kuna, the...

title: Croatia’s Retail Spending Rises for 31st Consecutive Month, Signalling Ongoing Economic Growth
description: Retail spending in Croatia continued its long-running upward trend in October, increasing on an annual level for the 31st month in a row, according to the latest report from the Croatian Bureau of Statistics (DZS). The pace of growth also accelerated compared with the previous month, underscoring th...

title: Croatia's ruling conservatives win parliamentary vote, but cannot rule alone
description:
Prime Minister incumbent Andrej Plenkovic waves after claiming victory in a parliamentary election in Zagreb, Croatia, Thursday, April 18, 2024. (Photo/AP)

title: Croatia expresses interest in investing in defence, other sectors: Commerce Ministry
description:
Mumbai (Maharashtra), [India], April 29 (ANI): Croatia has expressed its interest of investment in Indian defence sector, solar cells production, food processing technology, Automobiles, knowledge sharing amongst other sectors, the Commerce and Industry Ministry said in a statement on Tuesday.

title: Croatia Records Slight Employment Growth in October, Trade Sector Remains Largest Employer
description:
Croatia ended October 2025 with 1.52 million employees in legal entities, marking a 0.6% increase compared to September, according to new data released by the Croatian Bureau of Statistics (DZS). However, employment in legal entities was 0.1% lower than in October last year.
